alert.note: Alert for Humacao; Naguabo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 07 at 3:05AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following , Humacao and Naguabo. * WHEN...Until 615 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to one half inch of rain has fallen in the last several hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of one half to one and one half inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in urban and small stream flooding. Mudslides cannot be ruled out. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
